posts.message:
In my company we are responsible of about 35 applications mostly written in C# and VB.net (with Microsoft SQL) we are using TFS for the source code and pretty much everyone in the team is ok with it now (el 7amd lellah).
The problem is databases aren't under any form of version control, I know this can't continue this way. I am going to be the person who changes that so I'm trying to come up with the whole process. I have researched few things but not sure which way to go:
- Continue using Microsoft SQL Management Studio for all the DB work and just connect it with TFS and check in the change scripts.
OR
- Abandon the Management studio and use Microsoft Visual studio (we have 2013) for the DB design, edit, and so on. And this way I can use TFS to keep the DB under control. 
I'm open to all suggestions, but be mindful we are really trying to keep it inside the Microsoft house.
Thank you all.

posts.caption: grahamcluley.com
posts.description: The CallJam malware masquerades as a four-star rated Android game on Google Play, and has a worrying addiction to making premium rate phone calls.

posts.message: سلام عليكم ياريت اللى عنده مشكلة فى مصر  فى البنك بتاعه مع paypal يبعت feedback بتفاصيل المشكلة ل paypal عشان هما بيجمعوا feedbacks بخصوص المشاكل مع البنوك المصرية عشان يتواصلوا مع البنك المركزى وان شاء الله نأمل خير انهم يوصلوا لحل دى محاولة مش هتأخد منك أكتر من 5 دقايق الكلام ده بناء على customer service agent كلمنى وقالى على الخطوة دى

هل فيه طريقه اقدر  فى الـ live  ف الفيسبوك أنى استخدم كاميرا خارجيه غير كاميرا الموبايل؟ 
مثلا :- GoPro camera

posts.caption: pcworld.com
posts.description: A security researcher demonstrated that all it takes to steal an OS account's password hash from a Windows computer in a locked state, is to plug in a special USB device for a few seconds.

posts.message:
my latest open source project in golang, is for docker .
it's a standalone automated http reverse proxy for docker containers, i called it "droxy" ( [D]ocker p[roxy] )  .
https://github.com/alash3al/droxy
--
we know that there is another one but it uses "nginx" + "docker-gen"
Is there a good software to restore and data from a formatted hard disk, which actually restore anything back and have been used by anyone ?!
